questions.text: A 41-year-old woman is diagnosed with pancreatitis, in part owing to her elevated serum triacylglycerol levels. To form triacylglycerol from diacylglycerol, which of the following compounds is also required?

An 18-year-old woman presents with xanthomas on her eyelids and is found to have a rare genetic deficiency of lipoprotein lipase. She is diagnosed with type I hyperlipidemia. In this disorder, chylomicrons are abnormally elevated in the serum. In which cell or tissue does triacylglycerol packaging into chylomicrons occur?
Which one of the following amino acids is essential in the human diet?
All of the following statements concerning fuel metabolism are true except

options.label: A
options.text: Muscle protein can be a source of fuel for the body

options.label: B
options.text: Negative nitrogen balance occurs when the amount of nitrogen excreted in urine is greater than the amount of nitrogen ingested in the diet

options.label: C
options.text: Dietary protein is not required because amino acids can be synthesized from glu- cose

options.label: D
options.text: A person who ingests 100 g of protein/day will excrete about 16 g of nitrogen in the urine.

questions.correct_answer: C. Dietary protein is not required because amino acids can be synthesized from glu- cose

questions.text: Which of the following would be observed in a person who is resting after an overnight fast?

options.label: A
options.text: Liver glycogen stores are completely depleted

options.label: B
options.text: Liver gluconeogenesis is not an important process

options.label: C
options.text: Muscle glycogen stores are used to maintain blood glucose

options.label: D
options.text: Fatty acids are released from adipose triacylglycerol stores

questions.correct_answer: D. Fatty acids are released from adipose triacylglycerol stores

questions.text: Production of which of the following proteins would be most directly affected in scurvy?

A 5-year-old mentally retarded child is seen by an ophthalmologist for ‘‘blurry vision.’’ Ocular examination demonstrates bilateral lens dislocations, and further workup is significant for osteoporosis and homocystinuria. Serum analysis would most likely show an elevation of which of the following substances?
Substrate level Phosphorylation in Glycolysis is seen in which step?
Pyrimidine synthesis rate limiting enzyme is?
Nitric oxide is synthesized from?

A 3-month-old child presents with vomiting and convulsions. Notable findings include hepatomegaly and hyperammonemia. A deficiency in which of the following enzymes would most likely cause an elevation of blood ammonia levels?

Endonuclease activation and chromatin fragmentation are characteristic features of eukaryotic cell death by apoptosis.Which of the following chromosome structures would most likely be degraded first in an apoptotic cell?

Cytosine arabinoside (araC) is used as an effective chemotherapeutic agent for cancer, although resistance to this drug may eventually develop. In certain cases, resistance is related to an increase in the enzyme cytidine deaminase in the tumor cells. This enzyme would inactivate araC to form
A double-stranded RNA genome isolated from a virus in the stool of a child with gastroenteritis was found to contain 15% uracil. What is the percentage of guanine in this genome?

It is now believed that a substantial proportion of the single nucleotide substitutions causing human genetic disease are due to misincorporation of bases during DNA replication. Which proofreading activity is critical in determining the accuracy of nuclear DNA replication and thus the base substitution mutation rate in human chromosomes?

options.label: A
options.text: 3' to 5' polymerase activity of DNA polymerase

options.label: B
options.text: 3' to 5' exonuclease activity of DNA polymerase Y

options.label: C
options.text: 5' to 3' polymerase activity of DNA polymerase III

options.label: D
options.text: 3' to 5' exonuclease activity of DNA polymerase b

questions.correct_answer: D. 3' to 5' exonuclease activity of DNA polymerase b

questions.text: The proliferation of cytotoxic T-cells is markedly impaired upon infection with a newly discovered human immunodeficiency virus, designated HIV-V. The defect has been traced to the expression of a viral-encoded enzyme that inactivates a host-cell nuclear protein required for DNA replication. Which protein is a potential substrate for the viral enzyme?
The active site of an enzyme

options.label: A
options.text: Is formed only after addition of a specific substrate

options.label: B
options.text: Is directly involved in binding of allosteric inhibitors

options.label: C
options.text: Resides in a few adjacent amino acid residues in the primary sequence of the polypeptide chain

questions.text: A child is noted to have recurrent respiratory infections that necessitate hospitalization. His laboratory tests demonstrate a decrease in T cells, B cells, and NK cells. He has decreased levels of circulating antibodies and is diagnosed with severe combined immunodeficiency. The enzyme that is defective in this disorder is important in which one of the following processes?

options.label: A
options.text: The conversion of ribonucleotides to deoxyribonucleotides

options.label: B
options.text: The de novo synthesis of AMP

options.label: D
options.text: The de novo synthesis of UMP

questions.text: A 7-year-old boy suffers from mental retardation and self-mutilation (e.g., biting through lip) and has an increased susceptibility to gout. These symptoms are characteristic of Lesch-Nyhan syndrome, which is due to a mutation in which of the following pathways?
Porphyria cutanea tarda is the most common of the porphyrias and results from a deficiency of ?
A 54-year-old presents with impaired memory, diarrhea, and a rash on the face, neck, and dorsum of the hands. Which vitamin deficiency do these symptoms represent?

A 32-year-old woman presents with extreme fatigue and vague neurologic complaints. On examination, it is found that she has decreased positional and vibrational sense, and her complete blood count reveals a megaloblasticanemias. She relates a history of gastric resection 4 years ago for severe stomach ulcers. Which vitamin deficiency does this represent?
In glycolysis, the first committed step is catalyzed by?
Cholesterol present in LDL is?

options.label: A
options.text: Binds to a cell receptor and diffuses across the cell membrane

options.label: B
options.text: When it enters the cell it suppress the activity of ACAT

options.label: C
options.text: Once in the cell is converted to cholesteryl ester by LCAT

options.label: D
options.text: Once it has accumulated in the cell, inhibits replenishment of LDL receptor.

questions.correct_answer: D. Once it has accumulated in the cell, inhibits replenishment of LDL receptor.

questions.text: A 55-year-old man suffers from cirrhosis of the liver. He has been admitted to the hospital several times for hepatic encephalopathy. His damaged liver has compromised his ability to detoxify ammonia. Which of the following amino acids can be used to fix ammonia and thus transport and store ammonia in a nontoxic form?
Arachidonic Acid is synthesized from?
End product of Purine metabolism is?
Amino acid used in Carnitine synthesis is?

A 12-year-old boy presents with fatigue, polydipsia, polyuria, and polyphagia. A fingerstick glucose measurement shows a glucose level of 350mg/dL in his serum. He is diagnosed with type 1 diabetes mellitus, a disease characterized by a deficiency of insulin.Which one of the following is most likely occurring in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased fatty acid synthesis from glucose in liver

options.label: B
options.text: Decreased conversion of fatty acids to ketone bodies

options.label: C
options.text: Increased stores of triacylglycerol in adipose tissue

options.label: C
options.text: Accumulation of fat in the liver

options.label: C
options.text: May be used in diabetes mellitus patients to detect complications

questions.text: Which of the following is an activator of LCAT?
A competitive inhibitor of an enzyme

options.label: A
options.text: Increases K. but does not affect V¬m

options.label: B
options.text: Decreases Km but does not affect Vm

options.label: C

questions.text: The value of Km for the enzyme depicted by curve A is
Vitamin B12 acts as a co-enzyme to which of the following enzyme?
Which of the following statements concerning replication of DNA is true?

options.label: A
options.text: It progresses in both directions away from each point of origin on the chromosome

options.label: B
options.text: It requires a DNA template that is copied in its 5' to 3' direction

options.label: C
options.text: It occurs during the M phase of the cell cycle

options.label: D
options.text: It produces one newly synthesized double helix and one composed of the two parental strands

questions.correct_answer: A. It progresses in both directions away from each point of origin on the chromosome

questions.text: Which one of the following statements is true concerning fat metabolism in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: The thoracic duct carries a substantial volume of lymph and triglycerides from the enteric circulation to the venous system.

options.label: B
options.text: Triacylglycerol is primarily stored in the liver.

options.label: C
options.text: In the intestinal cell, glucose is converted to triacylglycerol by phosphatidic acid.

options.label: D
options.text: In adipose cells, triacylglycerol is converted to VLDL.

questions.correct_answer: A. The thoracic duct carries a substantial volume of lymph and triglycerides from the enteric circulation to the venous system.

questions.text: An 18-year-old obese woman maintains a sedentary lifestyle and eats a high-fat, high carbohydrate diet. Maintenance of this diet and lifestyle has led to lipogenesis and obesity. Which of the following statements correctly describes an aspect of lipogenesis?

options.label: A
options.text: The primary source of carbons for fatty acid synthesis is glycerol.

options.label: B
options.text: Fatty acids are synthesized from acetyl CoA in the mitochondria.

options.label: C
options.text: Fatty acid synthesis and esterification to glycerol to form triacylglycerols occurs primarily in muscle cells.

options.label: D
options.text: The fatty acyl chain on the fatty acid synthase complex is elongated two carbons at a time.

questions.correct_answer: D. The fatty acyl chain on the fatty acid synthase complex is elongated two carbons at a time.

questions.text: A 45-year-old man presents with multiple gunshot wounds to the abdomen requiring an emergent laparotomy, jejunectomy, and colectomy. After surgery, he is placed on intravenous nutrition (i.e., TPN). Which of the following compounds should be a component of TPN?
Before being oxidized, fatty acids are activated in the cytosol to form which of the following?
Decreased activity in b-glucuronidase is indicative of which of the following syndromes?

A 14-day-old breast-fed neonate fails to gain weight during infancy. Although concerned, the mother continues to breast-feed and wait. The infant subsequently develops cataracts, an enlarged liver, and mental retardation. Urinalysis is significant for high levels of galactose in the urine, as well as galactosemia. What food product in the baby’s diet is leading to these symptoms?
DNA contains which one of the following components?

options.label: A
options.text: Nitrogenous bases joined by phosphodiester bonds

options.label: B
options.text: Negatively charged phosphate groups in the interior of the molecule

options.label: C
options.text: Base pairs stacked along the central axis of the molecule

options.label: D
options.text: Two strands that run in the same direction

questions.correct_answer: C. Base pairs stacked along the central axis of the molecule

questions.text: In an embryo that lacked nucleoli, the synthesis of which type of RNA would be most directly affected?
Eukaryotic genes that produce mRNA

options.label: A
options.text: Contain a TATA box downstream from the start site of transcription

options.label: B
options.text: May contain a CAAT box in the 5' flanking region

options.label: C
options.text: Are transcribed by RNA polymerase III

options.label: D
options.text: Contain long stretches of thymine nucleotides that produce the poly(A) tail of mRNA

questions.correct_answer: B. May contain a CAAT box in the 5' flanking region

questions.text: A common mutagenic event is the deamination of cytosine in DNA to form uracil. If the damaged strand is replicated, a CG base pair in DNA will be converted to a

options.label: D

questions.text: Proteins that are secreted from cells

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Are produced from translation products that have a signal sequence at the C-terminal end

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: C. Are synthesized on ribosomes that bind to proteins on the endoplasmic reticulum

questions.text: In bacterial operons that are inducible

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: The inducer stimulates binding of RNA polymerase to the promoter

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: Structural genes that are adjacent on the DNA are coordinately expressed in response to the inducer

questions.correct_answer: D. Structural genes that are adjacent on the DNA are coordinately expressed in response to the inducer

In which region of the Factor V gene would this mutation most likely be located?

Respiratory tract infections caused by Pseudomonas aeruginosa are associated with the secretion of exotoxin A by this organism. What effect will this toxin most likely have on eukaryotic cells?

A culture of E. coli is grown in a medium containing glucose and lactose. The expression of the lactose operon over time in the cells is shown in the graph below. Which statementbest describes the change that occurred at point A?

options.label: A
options.text: Lactose was added to the culture

options.label: B
options.text: cAMP concentration increased in the cells

options.label: C
options.text: Repressor protein dissociated from the operator

options.label: D
options.text: Repressor protein became bound to the operator

questions.correct_answer: B. cAMP concentration increased in the cells

questions.text: Each of the following vitamins is required for reactions in the oxidation of pyruvate to CO2 and H20 except

A 4-month-old infant presents with a seizure. His mother reports that her infant has been irritable and lethargic over the past several days. The infant is found to be profoundly hypoglycemic and have low ketones. Short-chain dicarboxylic acids are found to be elevated in the serum. The most likely enzyme deficiency is which of the following?
A Which of the following is the primary role of carnitine?

options.label: A
options.text: Activates long-chain fatty acids in the cytosol

options.label: B
options.text: Transport of acyl groups across the inner mitochondrial membrane

options.label: D
options.text: Is involved in breakdown of even-chain, but not odd-chain, fatty acids

questions.correct_answer: B. Transport of acyl groups across the inner mitochondrial membrane

questions.text: Each of the following statements concerning pyruvate dehydrogenase is true except

options.label: A
options.text: It is an example of a multienzyme complex

options.label: B
options.text: It requires thiamine pyrophosphate as a cofactor

options.label: D
options.text: It is converted to an inactive form by phosphorylation

questions.correct_answer: C. It produces oxaloacetate from pyruvate

questions.text: During exercise, stimulation of the TCA cycle results principally from

options.label: A
options.text: Allosteric activation of isocitrate dehydrogenase by increased NADH

options.label: B
options.text: Allosteric activation of fumarase by increased ADP

options.label: C
options.text: A rapid decrease in the concentration of four-carbon intermediates

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: D. Stimulation of the flux through a number of enzymes by a decreased NADH/NAD+ ratio

questions.text: A patient has a genetic defect that causes intestinal epithelial cells to produce disaccharidases of much lower activity than normal.Compared to a normal person, after eating a bowl of milk and oatmeal, this patient will have higher levels of

options.label: A

options.label: C
options.text: Galactose and fructose in the blood

questions.correct_answer: A. Maltose, sucrose, and lactose in the stool

questions.correct_answer: C. It catalyzes a reaction that requires ATP

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C

questions.text: S-Adenosylmethionine (SAM) serves as the methylating agent for each of the following except

options.label: A
options.text: The conversion of norepinephrine to epi-nephrine

options.label: B
options.text: The synthesis of creatine from guanidinoacetate

options.label: C
options.text: The synthesis of phosphatidylcholine from phosphatidylethanolamine

options.label: D
options.text: The conversion of dUMP to dTMP

questions.correct_answer: D. The conversion of dUMP to dTMP

questions.text: Splicing activity seen in
Each of the following statements concerning pyruvate dehydrogenase complex is true except

options.label: A
options.text: It is an example of a multienzyme complex

options.label: B
options.text: It requires thiamine pyrophosphate as a cofactor

options.label: D
options.text: It is converted to an inactive form by phosphorylation

questions.correct_answer: C. It produces oxaloacetate from pyruvate

questions.text: A 3-year-old boy is brought to the emergency room with abdominal pain, mental status changes, and fatigue. On history, the physician finds that the patient lives in an older house and has been sucking on the paint chips that have crumbled in the windowsills, making the doctor suspicious for lead poisoning. Lead typically interferes with which of the following enzymes?

options.label: B
options.text: A storage form of high-energy phosphate

options.label: D
options.text: Stimulates the release of hydrochloric acid from the stomach

questions.correct_answer: B. A storage form of high-energy phosphate

questions.text: A native of East Africa presents withjaundice and splenomegaly after eatingfava beans. A blood smear revealshemolysis.

A 19-year-old, African military recruit was given a prophylactic dose of primaquine to prevent malaria. Several days after he begins taking the drug, he develops fatigue and hemolytic anemia. Which of the following proteins is likely deficient?

A couple of African American descent gives birth to a boy after an otherwise uneventful pregnancy. The child is exceptionally fair skinned and has almost white hair. Further examination reveals red pupils. A postnatal screen is likely to confirm the deficiency of which of the following enzymes in the child?

Which additional nucleotide sequence should be included in this vector to ensure optimal production of the thymidylate synthase?

Insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus (IDDM) is caused by a decreased ability of the ? cells of the pancreas to produce insulin. A person with IDDM who has neglected to take insulin injections will have

options.label: A
options.text: Increased fatty acid synthesis from glucose in liver

options.label: B
options.text: Decreased conversion of fatty acids to ketone bodies

options.label: C
options.text: Increased stores of triacylglycerol in adipose tissue

options.label: D
options.text: Increased conversion of acetoacetate to acetone.

questions.correct_answer: D. Increased conversion of acetoacetate to acetone.

During the metabolism of the branched- chain amino acids

options.label: A

options.label: B

questions.correct_answer: D. Leucine is converted to acetoacetate.

options.label: A

questions.text: Statins are competitive inhibitors of HMG-CoA reductase, which converts HMG-CoA to which of the following?
A 45-year-old woman presents with oily, foul-smelling stool, which appears to be due to an obstruction of the bile duct. Which of the following statements correctly describes bile salts?

options.label: A
options.text: They can act as detergents, aiding in lipid digestion.

options.label: B
options.text: They are stored in the intestines.

options.label: C
options.text: Bile salts are synthesized in the intestines.

options.label: D
options.text: Squalene and lanosterol are examples of bile salts.

questions.correct_answer: A. They can act as detergents, aiding in lipid digestion.

questions.text: Reading of codon on mRNA is
High serum HDL levels are protective against the development of atherosclerosis because they ?

options.label: A
options.text: Inhibits cholesterol production by the liver

options.label: D
options.text: Brings cholesterol esters back to the liver

questions.correct_answer: D. Brings cholesterol esters back to the liver

questions.text: The first reaction involved in degradation of most of the amino acid involves the participation of
Which of the following statements best describes patients with type II familial hypercholesterolemia?

options.label: A
options.text: After LDL binds to the LDL receptor, the LDL is degraded extracellularly.

options.label: B
options.text: The number of LDL receptors on the surface of hepatocytes increases.

options.label: D
options.text: Excessive cholesterol is released by LDL.

options.label: E
options.text: The cholesterol level in the serum decreases

questions.correct_answer: C. Cholesterol synthesis by hepatocytes increases.

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman presents with an LDL serum level of 400 (recommended level is <130), and a triglyceride level of 170 (recommended level is <150). She is diagnosed with type II familial hypercholesterolemia. In this disorder, a mutated LDL receptor is formed, such that it cannot bind to LDL. Which of the following would result?

options.label: A
options.text: Cellular HMG-CoA reductase activity is not inhibited.

options.label: B
options.text: The VLDL level in the serum increases.

options.label: C
options.text: The HDL level in the serum increases

options.label: D
options.text: The VLDL cannot be converted to IDL.

questions.correct_answer: A. Cellular HMG-CoA reductase activity is not inhibited.

questions.text: During exercise, stimulation of the TCA cycle results principally from

options.label: A
options.text: Allosteric activation of isocitrate dehydrogenase by increased NADH

options.label: B
options.text: Allosteric activation of fumarase by increased ADP

options.label: C
options.text: A rapid decrease in the concentration of four-carbon intermediates

options.label: D
options.text: Stimulation of the flux through a number of enzymes by a decreased NADH/NAD+ ratio

questions.correct_answer: D. Stimulation of the flux through a number of enzymes by a decreased NADH/NAD+ ratio

questions.text: Select the statement which is not correct

options.label: A
options.text: The side chain of cysteine and methionine absorb light at 280 nm

options.label: B
options.text: Glycine is often present at a region where a polypeptide is forming a sharp bend reversing the direction of a polypeptide

options.label: C
options.text: The C,N,H and O atoms of a peptide bond are coplanar

options.label: D
options.text: A linear pentapeptide contain four peptide bond

questions.correct_answer: A. The side chain of cysteine and methionine absorb light at 280 nm

questions.text: Which one of the following proteins is found in the thick filaments of skeletal muscle?

Which of the following statement is not correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Metabolic disorder are only infrequently associated with defects in catabolism of purines

options.label: B
options.text: Immune dysfunction are associated both with defective adenosine deaminase and defective purine nucleoside phosphorylase

options.label: C
options.text: Xanthine lithiasis can be due to severe defect in xanthine oxidase

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: A. Metabolic disorder are only infrequently associated with defects in catabolism of purines

questions.text: A 25-year-old woman presents with a low red blood cell count, corneal opacities, and kidney insufficiency. She is diagnosed with LCAT deficiency. LCAT is involved in which of the following processes?

options.label: B
options.text: The transfer of cholesterol esters from HDL to other lipoproteins

options.label: C
options.text: Endocytosis of HDL particles into hepatocytes

options.label: D
options.text: Decreased uptake of cholesterol by Hepatocytes

questions.correct_answer: A. Converting cholesterol to cholesterol esters

options.label: B
options.text: RFLP results from a single base change

options.label: C
